law.catch_line: Board not to adopt land-use regulations before referendum.
law.text: The board shall not enact land-use regulations into law until after it has caused due notice to be given of its intention to conduct a referendum submitting such regulations to the owners and occupiers of lands lying within the boundaries of the district, the referendum has been held, and the board has considered the result of the referendum. The proposed regulations shall be embodied in a proposed ordinance.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 42i-9.
